required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of Cleft Lip and Palate Conditions in Guatemala
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Cleft Lip and Palate Between a United States Tertiary Care Center and a Guatemalan Surgical Mission: A Cohort Study of 629 Pediatric Patients and a Survey of Risk Factors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare types of and risk factors for cleft lip and palate in a Guatemalan population to a United States population.

detailed_description.textblock: Demographic, surgical, and cleft type data from US patients were gathered via chart review of the electronic medical record. Data from Guatemalan patients was gathered orally from patient caregivers in their native language. Consent was also given orally in the caregivers native language. All data was de-identified prior to analysis.

primary_outcome.description: Presence, laterality, and completeness of cleft lip and/or palate as classified by the LAHSHAL system, data gathered by physical exam

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of potential risk factors for cleft lip and palate such as maternal exposures during pregnancy, data gathered by interview with caregivers
Type of surgery scheduled and patient age at time of scheduled surgery, data gathered by chart review

arm_group.description: Children with isolated cleft lip and/or cleft palate scheduled for surgery between 2012 to 2019 at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, Philadelphia, PA, USA.
Children with isolated cleft lip and/or cleft palate scheduled for surgery between 2017 and 2020 with Smiles for Guatemala, Guatemala City, Guatemala.

intervention.description: Survey instrument was administered verbally to parents of the Guatemalan cohort.

study_pop.textblock: Children with isolated cleft lip and/or palate scheduled for cleft-related surgery at either the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia or Smiles for Guatemala during the previously described time frames

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of isolated cleft lip and/or palate
- scheduled for cleft-related surgery at either the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia or Smiles for Guatemala during the previously described time frames
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of a recognized medical syndrome
- medically complex defined as having major medical problems in three or more organ systems
- diagnosis of isolated midline cleft lip
- diagnosis of Tessier facial cleft
- greater than 18 years of age
